page.title: 09Dykes Around Holbeach Bank
page.content: After the sea wall was built the land was still wet so they dug dykes to drain the land. Today there are many dykes around Holbeach Bank.Some dykes were man made and some are old rivers that have been straightened out. If you do not keep dykes clean they silt up so farmers get grass cutters for the grass at the side of the bank. We saw a dyke that had silted up. Weeds were growing there and blocking the water. If all the dykes got like this the land would get marshy again so the dykes are very useful. There is a lot of wildlife along the dykes They are a main part of our countryside. Some of the farmers have filled in the dykes and piped the water to gain extra land.
